content.text:
# List of Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign political endorsements

A range of notable individual politicians and political organizations endorsed Donald Trump for the 2024 U.S. presidential election.
Former executive branch officials
Congressional legislators
State and local officials
International politicians
Party officials
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
Current
Republican National Committee officials
* Morton Blackwell, Republican National Committeeman from Virginia (1988–present)
* Christina Bobb, Senior Counsel for Election Integrity of the Republican National Committee (2024–present)
* David Bossie, Republican National Committeeman from Maryland (2016–present)
* Duke Buchan, Finance Chair of the Republican National Committee (2022–present) and U.S. Ambassador to Spain and Andorra (2018–2021)
* Craig Campbell, Republican National Committeeman from Alaska (2022–present) and Lieutenant Governor of Alaska (2009–2010)
* Harmeet Dhillon, Republican National Committeewoman from California (2016–present)
* Luis Fortuño, Republican National Committeeman from Puerto Rico (2001–present), Shadow Representative from Puerto Rico (2017–2021), and Resident Commissioner of Puerto Rico (2005–2009)
* John H. Frey, Republican National Committeeman from Connecticut (2007–present)
* Chris LaCivita, chief operating officer of the Republican National Committee (2024–present)
* Debra Lamm, Republican National Committeewoman from Montana (2020–present)
* Leora Levy, Republican National Committeewoman from Connecticut (2016–present)
* Bill Palatucci, Republican National Committeeman from New Jersey (2010–present)
* Elizabeth Pipko, Spokesperson for the Republican National Committee (2024–present)
* Shawn Steel, Republican National Committeeman from California (2008–present) and Chair of the California Republican Party (2001–2003)
* Jane Timken, Republican National Committeewoman from Ohio (2024–present)
* Lara Trump, Co-chair of the Republican National Committee (2024-2025) (''Trump's daughter-in-law)
* Michael Whatley, Chair of the Republican National Committee (2024–present)
State party officials
* Rich Anderson, Chair of the Virginia Republican Party (2020–present)
* Rob Axson, Chair of the Utah Republican Party (2023–present)
* Mike Brown, Chair of the Kansas Republican Party (2023–present)
* Edward F. Cox, Chair of the New York Republican Party (2009–2019, 2023–present)
* Abraham George, Chair of the Texas Republican Party (2024–present)
* David Hann, Chair of the Minnesota Republican Party (2021–present)
* Pete Hoekstra, Chair of the Michigan Republican Party (2024–present) and U.S. Ambassador to the Netherlands (2018–2021)
* Bob Hugin, Chair of the New Jersey Republican Party (2021–present)
* D. Michael Hurst Jr., Chair of the Mississippi Republican Party (2024–present) and U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Mississippi (2017–2021)
* Justin Hwang, Chair of the Oregon Republican Party (2022–present)
* Gerard Kassar, Chair of the New York Conservative Party (2019–present) (Conservative Party of New York State)
* Jeff Kaufmann, Chair of the Iowa Republican Party (2014–present)
* Drew McKissick, Chair of the South Carolina Republican Party (2017–present)
* Joshua McKoon, Chair of the Georgia Republican Party (2023–present)
* Dorothy Moon, Chair of the Idaho Republican Party (2022–present)
* Jessica Millan Patterson, Chair of the California Republican Party (2019–2025)
* Evan Power, Chair of the Florida Republican Party (2024–present)
* Gina Swoboda, Chair of the Arizona Republican Party (2024–present)
* Don Tracy, Chair of the Illinois Republican Party (2021–present)
* Alex Triantafilou, Chair of the Ohio Republican Party (2023–present)
* John Wahl, Chair of the Alabama Republican Party (2021–present)
* Dave Williams, Chair of the Colorado Republican Party (2023–present)
County party officials
* Jose Arango, Chair of the Hudson County Republican Party (1989–present)
* Andrea Catsimatidis, Chair of the Manhattan Republican Party (2017–present)
* Woody Jenkins, Chair of the East Baton Rouge Parish Republican Party (2012–present)
* Anthony Sabatini, Chair of the Lake County Republican Party (2022–present)
* Alek Skarlatos, Douglas County Republican Precinct Committee Person for Precinct 12 (2022–present)
Former
Republican National Committee officials
* Thomas O. Hicks Jr., Co-chair of the Republican National Committee (2019–2023)
* Ronna McDaniel, Chair of the Republican National Committee (2017–2024)
* Bob Paduchik, Co-chair of the Republican National Committee (2017–2019) and Chair of the Ohio Republican Party (2021–2023)
* Todd Ricketts, Finance Chair of the Republican National Committee (2018–2022)
* Steve Wynn, Finance Chair of the Republican National Committee (2017–2018)
State party officials
* David Barton, Vice Chair of the Texas Republican Party (1997–2006)
* Brad Courtney, Chair of the Wisconsin Republican Party (2011–2019)
* Katon Dawson, Chair of the South Carolina Republican Party (2002–2009)
* Carson Jorgensen, Chair of the Utah Republican Party (2021–2023)
* Kristina Karamo, Chair of the Michigan Republican Party (2023–2024)
* Meshawn Maddock, Co-chair of the Michigan Republican Party (2021–2023)
* Ed Martin, Chair of the Missouri Republican Party (2013–2015)
* Andrew McKenna, Chair of the Illinois Republican Party (2005–2009)
* Ralph Reed, Chair of the Georgia Republican Party (2001–2003)
* Lily Tang Williams, Chair of the Colorado Libertarian Party (2015–2016) and Republican nominee for U.S. Representative from NH-02 in 2024
* Kelli Ward, Chair of the Arizona Republican Party (2019–2023)
* Allen Weh, Chair of the New Mexico Republican Party (2004–2009)
County party officials
* Kimberly Klacik, Member of the Baltimore County Republican Central Committee from the 6th district (2018–2022) and Republican nominee for MD-07 in 2020
Political operatives
]]
]]
* Nick Begich III, Alaska Policy Forum board member, grandson of former U.S. Representative Nick Begich Sr., and Republican candidate for U.S. Representative from AK-AL in 2024
* John Brabender, political consultant
* Eric Branstad, political consultant
* Phil Cox, political campaign manager
* Tony Fabrizio, pollster
* Harrison Floyd, senior Trump 2020 presidential campaign staff member
* Corey Lewandowski, political operative and lobbyist
* Paul Manafort, political consultant and convicted felon
* Brad Parscale, political advisor
* Kevin Roberts, political strategist and president of the Heritage Foundation
* Craig Shirley, political consultant
* Roger Stone, political consultant and lobbyist
* Susie Wiles, political consultant and CEO of Save America PAC (Trump campaign staff member)
Activists and public figures
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
]]
* Scott Adams, cartoonist and creator of Dilbert
* Sohrab Ahmari, founding editor of Compact''
* Noland Arbaugh, first human recipient of Neuralink's brain–computer interface implant
* Charly Arnolt, sports broadcaster for OutKick
* Raymond Arroyo, author, journalist, and producer
* Tim Ballard, founder and former CEO of Operation Underground Railroad
* Joe Biggs, Proud Boys leader and participant in the 2021 United States Capitol attack
* Del Bigtree, television and film producer, CEO of Informed Consent Action Network
* Michelle Bolsonaro, first lady of Brazil (2019–2023) (Liberal Party)
* Martha Boneta, policy advisor
* Dan Bongino, conservative talk radio host and political commentator
* Deneen Borelli, conservative author, radio and television personality, and columnist
* L. Brent Bozell III, founder of the Media Research Center
* Juanita Broaddrick, former nursing home administrator and Bill Clinton rape accuser
* David Brody, journalist and commentator
* Tammy Bruce, conservative radio host, author, and political commentator
* Jamie Bryson, Northern Irish loyalist activist
* Eric Bolling, conservative political commentator and television personality, former co-host of The Five
* Jon Caldara, libertarian activist and President of the Independence Institute
* Betty Cardenas, political activist and former chair of the Republican National Hispanic Assembly
* Tucker Carlson, conservative political commentator and former host of Tucker Carlson Tonight
* Bianca Censori, Australian architect and model
* Jacob Chansley, conspiracy theorist and participant in the 2021 United States Capitol attack (Libertarian)
* Chloe Cole, political activist
* Charles L. Cotton, President of the National Rifle Association of America
* Ann Coulter, political commentator
* Steven Crowder, conservative political commentator
* Giuseppe Cruciani, Italian radio personality and journalist
* Marjorie Dannenfelser, President of Susan B. Anthony Pro-Life America
* Steve Deace, conservative talk show host
* Diamond, NewsMax host (deceased)
* Tudor Dixon, conservative political commentator and Republican nominee for Governor of Michigan in 2022
* Dinesh D'Souza, conservative political commentator
* Myron Ebell, Director of Global Warming and International Environmental Policy at the Competitive Enterprise Institute
* Larry Elder, conservative radio host and attorney, Republican candidate for Governor of California in the 2021 recall election and former 2024 Republican presidential candidate
* Enes Kanter Freedom, Turkish human rights and democracy activist, member of the Gülen movement
* Brigitte Gabriel, author and founder of ACT for America
* Mike Gallagher, radio host and conservative political commentator
* Day Gardner, president of the National Black Pro-Life Union
* Brandon Gill, conservative news website founder, son-in-law of author Dinesh D'Souza, and Republican nominee for U.S. Representative from TX-26 in 2024
* Alan Gottlieb, gun rights advocate
* Kimberly Guilfoyle, television news personality
* Jeremy Griggs, online commentator and founder of Geeks + Gamers.
* Martin Gurri, former CIA analyst
* Greg Gutfeld, political commentator and comedian, host of Gutfeld! and co-host of The Five (Libertarian)
* Abraham Hamadeh, former prosecutor with the Maricopa County Attorney's Office
* Josh Hammer, conservative political commentator
* Sean Hannity, conservative television presenter and writer, host of Hannity and The Sean Hannity Show
* Natalie Harp, former television personality
* Kristan Hawkins, President of Students for Life of America
* Keith Hodge, conservative political commentator
* Kevin Hodge, conservative political commentator
* Charles Hurt, journalist and political commentator, opinion editor for The Washington Times and editor for Drudge Report
* Stella Inger, news anchor
* Laura Ingraham, conservative political commentator and host of The Ingraham Angle
* Alice Marie Johnson, criminal justice reform advocate and former federal prisoner
* Benny Johnson, conservative political commentator
* Drew Johnson, political columnist
* Raheem Kassam, editor-in-chief for The National Pulse
* Greg Kelly, conservative television commentator and retired U.S. Marine Corps Reserve lieutenant colonel, former co-host of Good Day New York
* Marty Kemp, First Lady of Georgia (2019–present)
* Robert F. Kennedy Jr., lawyer, environmentalist, anti-vaccine activist, and former 2024 presidential candidate (Independent, Democratic until 2023)
* Charlie Kirk, political activist and CEO of Turning Point USA
* Michael Knowles, conservative political commentator
* Tomi Lahren, conservative political commentator
* Kari Lake, former news anchor, Republican nominee for Governor of Arizona in 2022, and Republican nominee for U.S. Senate from Arizona in 2024
* Scott LoBaido, artist and sculptor
* Lara Logan, South African television journalist and war correspondent
* Laura Loomer, political activist and internet personality
* Mohammad Hosseini, political activist, radio host, and founder and leader of Restart
* Gina Loudon, conservative media personality
* Blake Marnell, political activist and media personality
* Jenny Beth Martin, co-founder of the Tea Party Patriots
* Eric Metaxas, radio host
* Michael the Black Man, conservative activist
* Stephen Moore, co-founder and former president of the Club for Growth
* Piers Morgan, English journalist and media personality, host of Piers Morgan Uncensored
* Dick Morris, political commentator and advisor to Bill Clinton
* Maye Musk, model and registered dietitian
* Sima Nan, Chinese television pundit, social commentator, and journalist
* Troy Newman, President of Operation Rescue
* Malik Obama, half-brother of Barack Obama
* Bill O'Reilly, conservative political commentator and television host
* Candace Owens, conservative political commentator and television presenter
* Yeonmi Park, North Korean defector and YouTuber
* Star Parker, syndicated columnist and conservative activist
* Mike Parry, British former journalist, radio presenter, and broadcaster
* CJ Pearson, conservative activist
* Liz Peek, political commentator and business analyst
* Solomon Peña, suspect in the drive-by shootings of New Mexico Democratic politicians
* Andrea Peyser, columnist for the New York Post (Democratic)
* Chris Plante, talk radio host and journalist
* Norman Podhoretz, conservative political commentator
* Jack Posobiec, conservative political commentator and senior editor for Human Events
* Dennis Prager, conservative radio talk show host and co-founder of PragerU
* Scott Presler, conservative activist
* Dave Ramsey, radio host and financial advisor
* Michael Reagan, political commentator and son of Ronald Reagan
* Stewart Rhodes, founder of the Oath Keepers and participant in the 2021 United States Capitol attack
* Kyle Rittenhouse, acquitted-suspect in the Kenosha unrest shooting and gun rights activist
* Wayne Allyn Root, television and radio host
* Lila Rose, anti-abortion activist, founder and president of Live Action
* Dave Rubin, libertarian-conservative political commentator
* Gayle Ruzicka, conservative activist
* Ned Ryun, CEO of American Majority
* Patricia Sandoval, anti-abortion activist
* Debra Saunders, columnist for the Las Vegas Review-Journal
* Nicole Shanahan, former nominee for U.S. Vice President in 2024 and civil rights attorney (Independent, Democratic until 2024)
* Ben Shapiro, conservative activist
* Silk, Newsmax host
* Olga Skabeyeva, Russian television presenter, political commentator, and propagandist of All-Russia State Television and Radio Broadcasting Company and Russia-1
* John Solomon, journalist and political commentator, former executive and editor-in-chief for The Washington Times
* Bill Spadea, radio host
* Robby Starbuck, conservative political activist and former music video director
* Sage Steele, former television anchor
* Leo Terrell, civil rights attorney and talk radio host
* Melania Trump, first lady of the United States (2017–2021) (''Trump's wife)
* Emmett Tyrrell, editor-in-chief for The American Spectator
* Batya Ungar-Sargon, journalist and author, deputy opinion editor for Newsweek and former opinion editor for The Forward
* Lucé Vela, first lady of Puerto Rico (2009–2013)
* Richard Viguerie, chair of ConservativeHQ.com
* Eva Vlaardingerbroek, Dutch right-wing political commentator and activist
* Matt Walsh, conservative political commentator
* David Wasinger, attorney and Republican nominee for Lieutenant Governor of Missouri in 2024
* Jesse Watters, conservative political commentator, co-host of The Five and host of Jesse Watters Primetime (Conservative'')
* Liz Wheeler, conservative political commentator
* Jason Whitlock, sports columnist and podcaster
* Lauren Witzke, far-right political activist and Republican nominee for U.S. Senate from Delaware in 2020
* Armstrong Williams, author and political commentator
* L. Lin Wood, former attorney
* Milo Yiannopoulos, British far-right political commentator
